 Marks the receiver as needing to update the labels before the content is next drawn.

 Updates the data labels.

 Sets the labelIndexRange and informs the receiver that it needs to relabel.
Data Loading

 Marks the receiver as needing the data source reloaded before the content is next drawn.
(void) - reloadData
 Reload data from the data source.
(void) - reloadDataIfNeeded
 Reload data from the data source only if the data cache is out of date.

Properties

Data Source
id< CPPlotDataSource > dataSource
 The data source for the plot.
Identification
id< NSCopying, NSObject > identifier
 An object used to identify the plot in collections.
Plot Space
CPPlotSpace * plotSpace
 The plot space for the plot.
Plot Area
CPPlotArea * plotArea
 The plot area for the plot.
Data Loading
BOOL dataNeedsReloading
 If YES, the plot data will be reloaded from the data source before the layer content is drawn.
Data Cache
NSUInteger cachedDataCount
 The number of data points stored in the cache.
BOOL doublePrecisionCache
 If YES, the cache holds data of type 'double', otherwise it holds NSNumber.
CPPlotCachePrecision cachePrecision
 The numeric precision used to cache the plot data and perform all plot calculations. Defaults to CPPlotCachePrecisionAuto.
Data Labels
BOOL needsRelabel
 If YES, the plot needs to be relabeled before the layer content is drawn.
CGFloat labelOffset
 The distance that labels should be offset from their anchor points. The direction of the offset is defined by subclasses.
CGFloat labelRotation
 The rotation of the data labels in radians. Set this property to M_PI/2.0 to have labels read up the screen, for example.
NSUInteger labelField
 The plot field identifier of the data field used to generate automatic labels.
CPTextStyle * labelTextStyle
 The text style used to draw the data labels. Set this property to nil to hide the data labels.
NSNumberFormatter * labelFormatter
 The number formatter used to format the data labels. Set this property to nil to hide the data labels. If you need a non-numerical label, such as a date, you can use a formatter than turns the numerical plot coordinate into a string (eg 'Jan 10, 2010'). The CPTimeFormatter is useful for this purpose.

Detailed Description

An abstract plot class.

Each data series on the graph is represented by a plot.

recordIndex: (NSUInteger)  index 

Retrieves a single number from the cache.

Parameters:

- (void) cacheNumbers: (id)  numbers
forField: (NSUInteger)  fieldEnum 

Copies an array of numbers to the cache.

Parameters:
numbers An array of numbers to cache. Can be a CPNumericData, NSArray, or NSData (NSData is assumed to be of type double).
fieldEnum The field enumerator identifying the field.

indexRange The range of the data indexes of interest.

Determines the smallest plot range that fully encloses the data for a particular coordinate.

Parameters:

Returns:
The plot range enclosing the data.

- (CPPlotRange *) plotRangeForField: (NSUInteger)  fieldEnum  

Determines the smallest plot range that fully encloses the data for a particular field.

Parameters:
fieldEnum The field enumerator identifying the field.
Returns:
The plot range enclosing the data.

- (NSRange) recordIndexRangeForPlotRange: (CPPlotRange *)  plotRange  

Determines the record index range corresponding to a given range of data.

Parameters:
plotRange The range expressed in data values.
Returns:
The range of record indexes. Returns {0, numberOfRecords} if the datasource does not implement the -recordIndexRangeForPlot:plotRange: method.
